hu.vadasz.peter.knockdetector.Detector

Class SimpleAudioKnockDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.vadasz.peter.knockdetector.Interfaces.KnockDetector
      • hu.vadasz.peter.knockdetector.Detector.AbstractAudioKnockDetector
        • hu.vadasz.peter.knockdetector.Detector.SimpleAudioKnockDetector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AudioRecorder.RawSignalReceiver

    public class SimpleAudioKnockDetector
extends AbstractAudioKnockDetector
    This class is based on Morse-coding and prefix (Huffman) coding. This class detects the rythm of the raw signal coming from AudioRecorder and transforms to byte series, which represents short, long syllables. The detector can have three states, depending on the time between two knocks. Depending on time between two knocks the detector changes its state. In FIRST_PHASE the detector detect short syllables, in SECOND_PHASE long syllables can be detected. If there was knock until the and of the SECOND_PHASE the detection terminates.
